title: Type on a curve
content:
do you know of an application that does envelopeing (sp) really well?   
I want to do type on a radius, and so far I've been drawing it by hand since the envelope tools in Illustrator and Fontlab are so primitive. I'd have thought that there is an app that would properly curve the flats at baseline xheight and ascender levels, and maintain alignment.
author: miles

comments.content: [TypeStyler](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221509/http:/www.typestyler.com/) from Strider Software might have what you're looking for. They have a [demo version](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221509/http:/www.typestyler.com/pages/demodl.html) available - no OS X version yet though.

Miles, Kai's Power Tools for illustrator   
is stuffed to the brim with envelopes   
and various stuff.   
   
I revert to Illustrator 6 to use it. I don't think   
it has any recent updates. Maybe you could   
find it on ebay.   
   
There's also FilterIt.   
   
 [http://www.cvalley.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221509/http:/www.cvalley.com/)   
   
bj

To get the level of detail that you describe, you will have to continue to draw it by hand.   
   
Not a bad thing.   
   
Why trust an algorhythm when the eye is so much more descerning.

Strangely enough Paint Shop Pro has been doing vector text on curves for a while, but its mainly a bitmap application, so its enveloping tools aren't that well developed.   
It does do text on a radius though, and as far as I recall, it curves the flats pretty well at all heights.
